com.radiusnetworks.campaignkit

Class CampaignKitManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.radiusnetworks.campaignkit.CampaignKitManager

  • public class CampaignKitManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The CampaignKitManager class is your primary interface to the data sent in by the Campaign Kit. Provides access to Campaigns after they've been triggered by the proper beacons/geofences.

    There is a small set of callbacks you can use to find out when a Campaign has been triggered in the CampaignKitNotifier.

    To initialize the Campaign Kit, simply download the CampaignKit.properties file from your Kit (on the website) and place it in the src folder of your project. Then, implement a CampaignKitNotifier in your Application class, and start up the CampaignKitManager in its onCreate() method. Here's an example: 

     public class MyApplication extends Application implements CampaignKitNotifier {
     public CampaignKitManager _ckManager;

     {@literal @}Override
     public void onCreate() {
         super.onCreate();
         _ckManager = CampaignKitManager.getInstanceForApplication(this);
         _ckManager.start();
         _ckManager.setNotifier(this);
     }
 }

    After that, you will be notified in the required method, didFindCampaign(Campaign campaign), whenever an active Campaign's Beacon is encountered and can respond accordingly.

    See Also:
    CampaignKitNotifier, Campaign

    • Method Detail

      • getInstanceForApplication

        public static CampaignKitManager getInstanceForApplication(Context context)
        An accessor for the singleton instance of this class. A context must be provided, but if you need to use it from a non-Activity or non-Service class, you can attach it to another singleton or a subclass of the Android Application class.

      • getInstance

        protected static CampaignKitManager getInstance()

      • didDetermineStateForRegion

        public void didDetermineStateForRegion(int state,
                              ProximityKitBeaconRegion region)
        Called with a state value of MonitorNotifier.INSIDE when at least one beacon in a Region is visible. Called with a state value of MonitorNotifier.OUTSIDE when no beacons in a Region are visible.
        Parameters:
        state - either MonitorNotifier.INSIDE or MonitorNotifier.OUTSIDE
        region - a Region that defines the criteria of beacons to look for

      • disableGeofences

        public void disableGeofences()
        Disables the detection of geofences.

        Geofences are disabled by default.

      • enableGeofences

        public void enableGeofences()
                     throws GooglePlayServicesException
        Enables the detection of geofences.

        Geofences are disabled by default, since Google Play Services must be installed on the device for them to work.

        Example of use: 

         // `this` must be an application object, or use `getApplication()`
 CampaignKitManager ckManager = ProximityKitManager.getInstanceForApplication(this);
 try {
     ckManager.enableGeofences();
 } catch(GooglePlayServicesException gpse) {
     //Google Play Services not available on this device
     gpse.printStackTrace();
 } catch (Exception e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
 }
 ckManager.start();
        Throws:
        GooglePlayServicesException

      • getFoundCampaigns

        public java.util.ArrayList getFoundCampaigns()
        Contains a list of all the campaigns that the app has found. This can be used to populate a ListView with all currently active campaigns that the app has encountered. This will return null prior to syncing.
        Returns:

      • removeCampaign

        public void removeCampaign(Campaign campaign)
        Removes Campaign from the list of triggered Campaigns. This will prevent the Campaign from being triggered for 60 seconds.

      • removeCampaign

        public void removeCampaign(java.lang.String id)
        Removes Campaign from the list of triggered Campaigns. This will prevent the Campaign from being triggered for 60 seconds.

      • setCampaignFulfilled

        public boolean setCampaignFulfilled(Campaign c,
                           Place p)
        Records a 'fulfilled' analytic for Campaign.

        Alternatively, fulfilled analytics may be recorded automatically by including Redemption Places when setting up your Campaigns on campaignkit.radiusnetworks.com. When a user has already found and viewed a Campaign, and then encounters a Redemption Place for that Campaign, then it will automatically be recorded as fulfilled.

        Parameters:
        c -
        p -
        Returns:

      • setCampaignViewed

        public boolean setCampaignViewed(Campaign campaign)
        Records a 'viewed' analytic for this Campaign.
        Parameters:
        campaign - the Campaign to mark as viewed if it is not already
        Returns:
        false if campaign has already been viewed or has not yet been marked found, true otherwise

      • setPartnerIdentifier

        public void setPartnerIdentifier(java.lang.String identifier)
        Sets the partner identifer string for analytics. Limited to 255 characters.
        Parameters:
        identifier - Custom identifier to attach to analytic events.
        Since:
        0.5.0

      • clearPartnerIdentifier

        public void clearPartnerIdentifier()
        Clears the partner identifier string for analytics.
        Since:
        0.5.0

        Sets the object that will receive all CampaignKit callbacks.
        Parameters:

      • setSyncInterval

        public void setSyncInterval(int milliseconds)
        Sets the length of time between sync with the Campaign Kit. In the event that a campaign is added or updated in the Campaign Kit, the app must sync in order to receive this new information. However, syncing does tax battery life significantly if performed too often, so we do not recommend setting this very low.

        This is set at one hour by default. The minimum setting is 5 minutes (300000 milliseconds).

        Parameters:
        milliseconds - Number of milliseconds to wait between each sync with Campaign Kit.

      • start

        public void start()
        Syncs data from CampaignKit, and once the sync is done, starts looking for iBeacons matching the beacon regions associated with the active campaigns in Campaign Kit, pre-enabling data callbacks to the CampaignKitNotifier.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop all Campaign Kit activities. This will:
        • Stop syncing to the cloud
        • Unregister all known geofences (if enabled)
        • Disconnect from the geofence service (if enabled)
        • Unregister all known beacons
        • Disconnect from the beacon service

      • sync

        public void sync()
        Forces a sync with the server to gather fresh Campaign data.

        To be used sparingly, since this taxes battery life of the user's device. For an alternate method, use setSyncInterval() instead. Syncing is set to occur once every hour by default.
        See Also:
        CampaignKitManager.setSyncInterval(int)
